content.description:
The first half is a fun inside corner starting with a layback that quickly escalates to crimps. The top half gets scrappy with loose rock until a solid finish up top. 

  Helmets on, this place has loose rock abound... at least until we knock it all off... (hence the PG-13)
content.protection: No leading here. Top rop is anchors are scattered and few but they can be found. We used two smaller trees (3in dia) and a stopper in a nearby rock.
content.location: Approx: 43.467643N, 88.584465W   Not far from the parking lot adjacent to the camp sites. Walk on trail toward cliff-line, turn right on trail that parallels cliffs, walk about 25 feet... Facing off the cliff there is a small access route to the left, the top of the actual climb is hidden in the grove of small trees to the right

content.description:
The first 15 feet are 5.Easy, while the last 15 work up the sweat. Stay low on the "nice" ledge/crack system as you traverse left, then power a move or two up to the finish. 

  PG-13 because the lower half rock is quite fractured. Everyone should have helmets on.
content.protection: Top rope only, don't even think about leading this... Large tree and several cracks in the rocks up top make for good anchors.
content.location: Approx: 43.467643N, 88.584465W   Not far from the parking lot adjacent to the camp sites. Walk on trail toward cliff-line, turn left on trail that parallels cliffs, walk about 75 feet... (past two benches) and then another 20 feet or so)

content.description: Start to the right of the pillar and go up the chimney. Didn't break off any hold when I was there but there are some loose holds.
content.location: Drive down to the north look for the dumpster on the left side of the road go straight out from there to the cliff.

content.description: Start in the middle of the face going straight up until the first ledge and then hanging a slight right on some good holds to the top.
content.protection: Top rope but pretending on the master point its better not to fall.
content.location: Just to the left of choss chimney.

content.description: I had this "area" created since I believe the bouldering here is more worth the time than toproping.  If you don't own a pad, then by all means go set up some anchors.  There are probably some possibilities for new development, but consider the choss factor, and bring a pair of helmets. Trad is probably not a good idea.
